articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Phil Stewart, Steve Holland
articles.description: Israel faced a missile attack on Sunday as Iran said it reserved all options to defend itself after unprecedented U.S. strikes that President Donald Trump said had obliterated its key nuclear facilities.
articles.title: Israel under missile attack, Iran says all options open after US strikes

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Sunday that U.S. military strikes against Iranian nuclear facilities were an incredible and overwhelming success that have obliterated Tehran's nuclear ambitions.
articles.title: US strikes 'obliterated' Iran's nuclear ambitions, Pentagon chief says

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: As Operation "Midnight Hammer" got underway on Saturday, a group of B-2 bombers took off from their base in Missouri and were noticed heading out toward the Pacific island of Guam, in what experts saw as possible pre-positioning for any U.S. decision to strike Iran.
articles.title: US bombing of Iran started with a fake-out

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Ukrainian military said the activity in the area prevented Russia from sending a significant number of its forces to Donetsk.
articles.title: Ukraine fighting 10,000 Russian troops in Kursk region, Ukrainian commander says

articles.author: Yiming Woo
articles.description: An anti-NATO protest in The Hague on Sunday shifted its focus to Iran after overnight U.S. strikes hit key nuclear sites there.
articles.title: Hague NATO summit protest shifts focus to Iran

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: A little over a month ago, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu appeared to have been shunted to the shadows by U.S. President Donald Trump, who hopscotched the Middle East without visiting Israel, traditionally Washington's closest regional ally.
articles.title: Despite clashes with US presidents, Israel's Netanyahu usually gets his way

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Airlines continued to avoid large parts of the Middle East on Sunday after U.S. strikes on Iranian nuclear sites, according to flight tracking website FlightRadar24, with traffic already skirting airspace in the region due to recent missile exchanges.
articles.title: Airlines keep avoiding Middle East airspace after US attack on Iran

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A blast rocked the Mar Elias Church in the Dweila neighbourhood of Syria's capital Damascus on Sunday, according to witnesses.
articles.title: Blast rocks church in Syria's Damascus, witnesses say

articles.author: Francois Murphy, John Irish
articles.description: U.S. military strikes overnight in which President Donald Trump said Iran's main nuclear sites were "obliterated" will put to the test the widely held view that such attacks can delay a nuclear programme but not kill a determined push for atom bombs.
articles.title: US strikes on Iran nuclear sites are real-life test of hard power's limits

articles.author: Saeed Shah
articles.description: In Karachi, a large American flag with a picture of Trump on it was placed on the road for demonstrators to walk over, along with chants against America, Israel and India.
articles.title: Pakistan condemns Trump's bombing of Iran - a day after nominating him for Peace Prize
